revised_title: Enamel Development in Elasmobranch Fishes: A Comparative Study
tldr: The author investigates the structure and development of the enamel in Elasmobranch fish teeth, comparing it to mammalian enamel and dentine. The study reveals that the enamel layer in Elasmobranch fish teeth is a joint product of the enamel organ and dentine papilla, differing from mammalian enamel formation. This research sheds light on the evolution of enamel as a separate tissue and its development in different species.
